content.description: Northeast facing arête and the leftmost of the two features; this climb starts on suspect rock that quickly turns into decent stone movements over easy terrain. Move slightly right near the top for a few moves when the climbing feels harder than a 5.8.

climbs.name: L.S.D.
climbs.fa: David Sampson, Larry Reinmuth and Devon Meyer

content.description: This is the first sport route in the Refuge. This east facing climb is located on a short wide tower below (and east) the Torch. On the right hand side of the structure in the center of a near-vertical face (bulge near the top). Face climb on a left arching bolted line pulling the bulge to reach the anchors.
content.location: Righthand of the two climbs of the area. See map.

content.description: The separate, east-facing wall that is below and closer to the road than the Torch. Two sport routes ascend this feature.
